intro: Eucomea humilis, commonly known as the dwarf eucomea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its small, delicate leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories. Eucomea humilis is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its unique appearance and relatively low maintenance requirements.
